74E9217B937C4370ADE3622E41963FF8.description:
Become an active
global citizen by experiencing language and culture in the workplace through possible internships.

20BE5B2FEC2542B78D03510CA9C10E60.description:
Apply
experiences from the Workplace Spanish classroom within local businesses or the community.

5B0D19977A7C4208B1A47C28F977B641.description: Compare how buying and selling products and services reflects local and community customs.

9C57987FC24E4D498B61AF2C7B7920B8.description:
Communities- Students can communicate and connect with cultural competence in order to
engage in multilingual workplaces at home and around the world.

29969E5E684E45E486C6F4E9FDC9B803.description:
Culture: Use learned behaviors in job-related interactions when visiting someone’s business, interacting with the
public, and amongst co-workers, and notice when they make a cultural mistake.

33D674B55055468DAF6D45D033301C05.description:
Language: Compare and contrast common idioms, colloquialisms, and workplace jargon (e.g. service, medical, and
job-specific vocabulary, etc)

99D168662C7C4473A005B0C34DEC8E78.description:
Comparisons- Students can understand the nature of the Spanish language and culture
through comparisons of their own culture.

AFC01586D26648C1B6AA5185D572145E.description:
Implement workplace concepts and skills through relevant activities. Examples: Currency conversions, measurement
conversions, resumé development, etc.

E24715E56F2B4FCD8EC2BAD0F6FCDBE1.description:
Use knowledge of other disciplines in order to communicate in Spanish to solve workplace problems. Examples:
Stress management, budgets, taxes, health-related vocabulary, etc.

F184078A6FB64470932C660FE19791FD.description:
Connections- Students can make connections between chosen careers and other content
areas in order to use Spanish to function in career-related situations.

6ED03DFE48C1450480B3F14270063B3B.description:
Describe influences on practices and products. Examples: Technology, current events, workplace rules, etiquette,
dress, etc.

226F43C41F1F4D7E82081D22980FD672.description:
Use appropriate reactions and responses to show cultural competence. Examples: Nonverbal, proximity, appropriate
greetings, gestures, formality in the workplace, etc.

05AE040C90954EDD9C541EF527B3551E.description:
Identify and recognize differences in behaviors and social practices. Examples: Gender and family roles, stereotypes,
schedules, punctuality, etc.

746E7554B0E84DDEB1E9E7B4114EA5E3.description:
Culture- Students can examine, experience, and reflect on the practices and perspectives of
the Hispanic and Spanish culture and how it will be evident in chosen career fields.

1AB1AC8AE2E344DD8D76E65B269B0713.description:
Express preferences on job-related topics and explain why they feel that way. Examples: Career pathway research,
advertisements for products or services, persuasive memos, letters of recommendation, etc.

2A608EBECC444E4187C2239E9E7F7AF7.description:
Present career-related information about activities, events, and qualifications. Examples: Steps of process, work
routine, simple project, professional goals, how-to instruction, cover letters, etc.

1709DBAA196A4D28B629774458ED644F.description:
Presentational Communication: Students can communicate information, make
presentations, and express thoughts about work related topics through spoken and written language.

EB2D8DBE3EB34399BCE3D3451BB90BA7.description:
Identify the main idea in short conversations. Examples: Places, times, and purpose for meetings/events, blog
responses to questions/comments, text conversation, video conference, etc.

C92F55A896884566AB5DD043BEAEF78C.description:
Identify workplace topics and related information from informational texts. Examples: Job postings, text messages,
social media posts, schedule of events, voicemail, training videos, etc.

879AD41AC34E4550B800B9EE6B93DCA6.description:
Interpretive Communication: Students can understand the main idea and some pieces of
information on work-related topics from texts that are spoken or written.

9BB2483FE29D4DB89460AE811CDA10FA.description:
Exchange ideas and knowledge in order to solve workplace problems. Examples: Tasks, advice on job-related topics,
customer service, etc.

B2B64DF9A7C6484997FD99F657B975DB.description:
Express, ask about, and react with some details to preferences, feelings, or opinions on workplace tasks, by creating
sentences and asking appropriate follow up questions. Examples: Share reactions via text/email, identify points of agreement,
share how-to ideas, etc.

67298010C17A466BBF8DDAA119DF945E.description:
Request and provide information in conversations on familiar topics by creating sentences and asking appropriate
follow-up questions. Examples: Arrange a meeting, collaborate online, exchange texts/ emails, interview practice, etc.

F99A888C32FC4D06ACDF576FB441FB85.description:
Interpersonal Communication: Students can participate in spontaneous or written
conversations on workplace related topics.
